workflow.name: Repurpose YouTube videos into blogs and social posts with GPT-4o, WordPress, LinkedIn, X and Instagram
workflow.description:
## Overview

This workflow turns a single YouTube video into multiple content formats and publishes them across different platforms with an optional human approval step.

It helps content creators, marketers, and agencies repurpose long-form video content into blog posts and social media updates automatically.

## How it works

1. Fetches the transcript from a YouTube video  
2. Uses AI to generate blog and social media content  
3. Optionally waits for manual approval  
4. Publishes content to selected platforms  
5. Logs the result for tracking

## Setup steps

1. Add your API credentials (AI, transcript, and social platforms)
2. Paste a YouTube video URL
3. Choose auto-publish or approval mode
4. Run the workflow

## Use cases

- Content repurposing for YouTube creators  
- Automated blog and social media publishing  
- Marketing automation for agencies  
- AI-assisted content production pipelines

---

### üßë‚Äçüíª Creator Information
Developed by: Adem Tasin

üíº LinkedIn: Adem Tasin

workflow.name: YouTube to Omnichannel Content Repurposing Workflow

parameters.content:
### What this workflow does

This workflow transforms a YouTube video into:
- A blog post
- LinkedIn post
- X (Twitter) threads
- Instagram caption

It supports both automatic publishing and manual approval before publishing.

### How it works

1. Fetches the YouTube transcript
2. Generates content using AI
3. (Optional) waits for human approval
4. Publishes content to selected platforms
5. Logs the publishing result

### Setup steps

1. Add your credentials (AI, transcript API, social platforms)
2. Paste a YouTube video URL
3. Choose your publishing mode
4. Execute the workflow

## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Input & Transcript

This section starts the workflow.

- Paste a YouTube video URL
- Fetch the video transcript using an external API
- Stop the workflow if no transcript is found

The transcript is normalized into a single text field for downstream AI processing.

## 2Ô∏è‚É£ Approval Handling

This section handles the approval logic.

Depending on the configuration, the workflow can:
- Automatically continue to publishing
- Pause and wait for manual approval
- Cancel or request revisions

This keeps the workflow flexible for both solo creators and teams.

## 3Ô∏è‚É£ Blog & LinkedIn Publishing

This section publishes long-form and professional content.

- Generates a blog post from the transcript
- Creates a LinkedIn post based on the same content
- Publishes or saves drafts depending on your platform settings

Useful for SEO and professional audience distribution.

## 4Ô∏è‚É£ X (Twitter) Threads

This section creates short-form content for X (Twitter).

- Breaks the main idea into multiple tweets
- Publishes them as a thread
- Each tweet is generated automatically from the original video content

Ideal for content amplification and reach.

## 5Ô∏è‚É£ Instagram Content

This section handles Instagram content.

- Generates an Instagram caption
- Optionally generates visual or reel ideas
- Publishes or prepares content for Instagram

Designed for high-engagement social platforms.

## 6Ô∏è‚É£ Logging & Completion

This section finalizes the workflow.

- Logs publishing results (for example in Notion)
- Tracks which platforms were used
- Marks the workflow execution as successful

Helps with content tracking and auditing.

user.name: Adem Tasin
user.bio:
I've been building automation workflows for over 3 years, mostly using tools like n8n, Zapier, and Make. I enjoy creating clean, reliable, and scalable automations that help small businesses and freelancers streamline their daily operations. My focus is on practical solutions ‚Äî from lead tracking to API integrations ‚Äî that are easy to understand and customize.

www.ademtasin.com

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
